intro: Hieracium canipedunculum, commonly known as the purple hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 cm. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers consist of yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Hieracium canipedunculum is known for its vibrant purple to pinkish flower color, which attracts various pollinators.
